name: Kodak DC25 Digital Photo
summary: Learn about .K25 files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: The Kodak DC25 is a digital camera that Kodak released in the late 1990s. Notably, the DC25 was the first Kodak digital camera that could save photos to a Compact Flash removable memory card. These photos, as well as photos saved to the camera's internal memory, were saved as K25 files.

description: A K25 file is a digital photo captured by a Kodak DC25 digital camera. It may contain a high-resolution photo or a standard-resolution photo. While K25 files are saved in a proprietary format, you can open them with XnViewMP, Microsoft Photos, and several other image viewers.

instructions: You can open a K25 file with Microsoft Photos, XnViewMP, or Corel AfterShot Pro, to view and edit the image it contains.
If you want to make extensive edits to the image your K25 file contains, you should open it with AfterShot Pro, as that program contains professional-level photo editing tools.
You can use XnViewMP, Logipole Konvertor, and ReaSoft Development ReaConverter to convert K25 files to other image formats, such as .JPG, .PNG, and .BMP.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .k25 file in XnViewMP
images.caption: K25 file open in XnViewMP
